alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 3:28PM MST until July 30 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 327 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Interstate 40 corridor in the Ash Fork area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in less than an hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ash Fork. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 131 and 156. Business Interstate 40 near mile marker 146. State Route 89 between mile markers 358 and 363. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hell Canyon, Eightmile Creek, Pineveta Wash, Big Chino Wash, Martin Dam Draw, Partridge Creek, Ash Fork Draw, Johnson Creek and Meath Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
